title: Eodermdrome
summary: An eodermdrome is a form of word play wherein a word (or phrase) is formed from a set of letters (or words) in such a way that it has a non-planar spelling net.  Gary S. Bloom, Allan Gewirtz, John W. Kennedy, and Peter J. Wexler first described the eodermdrome in May 1980,[1] and it subsequently became more widely known after publication in Word Ways: The Journal of Recreational Linguistics in August 1980.[2]
